title: Trump officials are learning how hard it is to sell $1 billion of their assets - Wall Street Journal
text:
Trump Officials Are Learning How Hard It Is to Sell $1 Billion of Their Assets Delays in disposing of illiquid investments leave some cabinet members facing possible restrictions By @RyanDezember March 15, 2017 11:08 a.m. ET 
Members of Donald Trumpâ€™s cabinet are obliged to sell more than $1 billion worth of assets to prevent conflicts of interest, a process that is proving difficult and time-consuming. 
A Wall Street Journal review of those needed sales shows almost three-quarters of the total is held in illiquid assets such as real estate, closely held companies and stakes in private-equity funds, likely extending the time necessary to unwind the...
